message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a method for matching pairs of articles by representing them as graphs of concepts and using graph convolutional networks to aggregate matching signals. This involves natural language processing techniques such as encoding and sentence matching. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques for matching articles, which makes cs.IR a likely sub-category as well. The use of graph convolutional networks suggests a focus on machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL), making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category. The paper also involves semantic understanding and knowledge representation, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
